project.para: Yung YiDiSH is a living yiddish museum. Work underway is to put online a verified easy-to-search and update catalog of the 40,000 yiddish book collection.

project.subject: SYRENE
project.para: SYRENE is SYndrome REasoning NEtwork. Syrene is a set of tools for experiments in syndrome analysis and explanation generation.
Implemented the system in Haskell as a by-product of research in Institute for Information Transmission Problems.

project.subject: RNV — Relax NG validator
project.para: RNV is an implementation of Relax NG Compact Syntax validator in ANSI C.

Implemented the validator from scratch. The validator is widely used and is known to be conformant and the fastest implementation of Relax NG. Wrote two implementations of W3C XML Schema Datatypes, in ANSI C and R5RS Scheme, for the validator.

project.subject: XEP — XSL Formatting Objects Rendering Engine
project.para: Designed and led a team of engineers to implement the first commercially available and still one of the best implementations of XSL Formatting Objects. Wrote core modules of the formatting engine.

project.subject: rwww — WWW Search Engine with Support for Russian Morphology
project.para: Designed and implemented a non-dictionary stemming algorithm for the Russian language (Rustem). Wrote the stemming module in Scheme and ANSI C. Modified and improved freeWAIS to support 8-bit encodings and calls to external wordform normalizers. Wrote a WWW scanning robot in Perl.
